pli-tv-bu-vb-pc69:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc69:0.4.eng: The subchapter on containing living beings

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc69:0.5.eng: 69. The training rule on living with one who has been ejected

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc69:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc69:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc69:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū jānaṃ tathāvādinā ariṭṭhena bhikkhunā akaṭānudhammena taṃ diṭṭhiṃ appaṭinissaṭṭhena saddhiṃ sambhuñjantipi saṃvasantipi sahāpi seyyaṃ kappenti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc69:1.2.eng: At that time the monks from the group of six lived with the monk Ariṭṭha, and they did formal meetings and shared a sleeping place with him. Yet they knew that he was saying such things, that he had not made amends according to the rule, and that he had not given up that view.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc69:1.2.comm: “Such things” refers back to the previous rule.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc69:1.3.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc69:1.3.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc69:1.4.pli: “kathañhi nāma chabbaggiyā bhikkhū jānaṃ tathāvādinā ariṭṭhena bhikkhunā akaṭānudhammena taṃ diṭṭhiṃ appaṭinissaṭṭhena saddhiṃ sambhuñjissantipi saṃvasissantipi sahāpi seyyaṃ kappessantī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc69:1.4.eng: “How can the monks from the group of six live, do formal meetings, and share a sleeping place with the monk Ariṭṭha, even though they know that he’s saying such things, that he hasn’t made amends according to the rule, and that he hasn’t given up that view?” …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc69:1.5.pli: “saccaṃ kira tumhe, bhikkhave, jānaṃ tathāvādinā ariṭṭhena bhikkhunā akaṭānudhammena taṃ diṭṭhiṃ appaṭinissaṭṭhena saddhiṃ sambhuñjathāpi saṃvasathāpi sahāpi seyyaṃ kappethā”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc69:1.5.eng: “Is it true, monks, that you do this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc69:1.8.pli: kathañhi nāma tumhe, moghapurisā, jānaṃ tathāvādinā ariṭṭhena bhikkhunā akaṭānudhammena taṃ diṭṭhiṃ appaṭinissaṭṭhena saddhiṃ sambhuñjissathāpi saṃvasissathāpi sahāpi seyyaṃ kappessatha.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc69:1.8.eng: “Foolish men, how can you do this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc69:1.10.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc69:1.10.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc69:1.11.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu jānaṃ tathāvādinā bhikkhunā akaṭānudhammena taṃ diṭṭhiṃ appaṭinissaṭṭhena saddhiṃ sambhuñjeyya vā saṃvaseyya vā saha vā seyyaṃ kappeyya, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc69:1.11.1.eng: ‘If a monk lives, does formal meetings, or shares a sleeping place with a monk who he knows is saying such things, who has not made amends according to the rule, and who has not given up that view, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc69:2.1.4.eng: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc69:2.1.6.pli: sāmaṃ vā jānāti, aññe vā tassa ārocenti, so vā āroceti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc69:2.1.6.eng: he knows by himself or others have told him or the offender has told him.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc69:2.1.6.comm: The meaning of the last of these three ways of knowing, so vā āroceti, is not clear. CPD suggests: “sa (sā) āroceti (?). Perhaps this last form is conformable to sa. ārocayate med. caus. in the meaning: he or she makes inquiries (of others).” However, this does not fit with the parallel usage at Bu Pc 29:3.1.6 where the text says that she tells (sā vā āroceti) him, presumably referring to the nun telling the monk. In this case āroceti cannot refer to the monk making inquiries. The commentaries are silent, and I therefore assume that a straightforward meaning is the most likely one. I would suggest, then, that it simply refers to the ejected monk telling him directly.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc69:2.1.8.pli: “tathāhaṃ bhagavatā dhammaṃ desitaṃ ājānāmi, yathā yeme antarāyikā dhammā vuttā bhagavatā, te paṭisevato nālaṃ antarāyāyā”ti evaṃ vādinā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc69:2.1.8.eng: one who says this: “As I understand the Buddha’s Teaching, the things he calls obstacles are unable to obstruct one who indulges in them.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc69:2.1.9.eng: Who has not made amends according to the rule:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc69:2.1.10.eng: who has been ejected and not readmitted.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc69:2.1.11.eng: With a monk who has not given up that view:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc69:2.1.12.eng: with a monk who has not given up this view.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc69:2.1.14.pli: sambhogo nāma dve sambhogā— āmisasambhogo ca dhammasambhogo ca.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc69:2.1.14.eng: there are two types of living together: material living together and spiritual living together.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc69:2.1.16.pli: āmisaṃ deti vā paṭiggaṇhāti vā, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc69:2.1.16.eng: if he gives or receives material things, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc69:2.1.18.pli: uddisati vā uddisāpeti vā, padena uddisati vā uddisāpeti vā, pade pade āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc69:2.1.18.eng: he recites or has the other recite. If he recites or has the other recite by the line, then for every line he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc69:2.1.19.pli: Akkharāya uddisati vā uddisāpeti vā, akkharakkharāya āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc69:2.1.19.eng: If he recites or has the other recite by the syllable, then for every syllable he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc69:2.1.21.pli: ukkhittakena saddhiṃ uposathaṃ vā pavāraṇaṃ vā saṅghakammaṃ vā karoti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc69:2.1.21.eng: if he does the observance-day ceremony, the invitation ceremony, or a legal procedure with one who has been ejected, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc69:2.1.21.comm: “Observance-day ceremony” renders uposatha. See Appendix of Technical Terms for discussion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc69:2.1.23.pli: ekacchanne ukkhittake nipanne bhikkhu nipajjati, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc69:2.1.23.eng: under the same ceiling: if the monk lies down when the one who has been ejected is already lying down, he commits an offense entailing confession;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc69:2.1.24.pli: Bhikkhu nipanne ukkhittako nipajjati, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc69:2.1.24.eng: if the monk is already lying down when the one who has been ejected lies down, he commits an offense entailing confession;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc69:2.1.25.eng: if they both lie down together, he commits an offense entailing confession;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc69:2.1.26.eng: every time they get up and then lie down again, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc69:2.2.1.pli: Ukkhittake ukkhittakasaññī sambhuñjati vā saṃvasati vā saha vā seyyaṃ kappeti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc69:2.2.1.eng: If the other monk has been ejected, and he perceives him as such, and he lives or does formal meetings or shares a sleeping place with him, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc69:2.2.2.pli: Ukkhittake vematiko sambhuñjati vā saṃvasati vā saha vā seyyaṃ kappeti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc69:2.2.2.eng: If the other monk has been ejected, but he is unsure of it, and he lives or does formal meetings or shares a sleeping place with him, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc69:2.2.3.pli: Ukkhittake anukkhittakasaññī sambhuñjati vā saṃvasati vā saha vā seyyaṃ kappeti, anāpatti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc69:2.2.3.eng: If the other monk has been ejected, but he does not perceive him as such, and he lives or does formal meetings or shares a sleeping place with him, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc69:2.2.4.eng: If the other monk has not been ejected, but he perceives him as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc69:2.2.5.eng: If the other monk has not been ejected, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc69:2.2.6.eng: If the other monk has not been ejected, and he does not perceive him as such, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc69:2.3.2.eng: if he knows that he has not been ejected;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc69:2.3.3.eng: if he knows that he has been readmitted after being ejected;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc69:2.3.4.eng: if he knows that he has given up that view;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc69:2.3.6.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc69:2.3.7.eng: The training rule on living with one who has been ejected, the ninth, is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmā udāyī sāvatthiyaṃ kulūpako hoti, bahukāni kulāni upasaṅkamati.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:1.2.eng: At that time Venerable Udāyī was associating with and visiting a number of families in Sāvatthī.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:1.3.pli: Atha kho āyasmā udāyī pubbaṇhasamayaṃ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya yena aññataraṃ kulaṃ tenupasaṅkami.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:1.3.eng: After robing up one morning, he took his bowl and robe and went to a certain family.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:1.4.pli: Tena kho pana samayena gharaṇī nivesanadvāre nisinnā hoti, gharasuṇhā āvasathadvāre nisinnā hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:1.4.eng: Just then the housewife was sitting at the door to the house, while the daughter-in-law at the door to guesthouse.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:1.5.pli: Atha kho āyasmā udāyī yena gharaṇī tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā gharaṇiyā upakaṇṇake dhammaṃ desesi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:1.5.eng: Udāyī went up to the housewife and gave her a teaching, whispering in her ear.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:1.7.pli: “kiṃ nu kho so samaṇo sassuyā jāro udāhu obhāsatī”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:1.7.eng: “Is this monastic my mother-in-law’s lover, or is he speaking indecently?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:1.8.pli: Atha kho āyasmā udāyī gharaṇiyā upakaṇṇake dhammaṃ desetvā yena gharasuṇhā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā gharasuṇhāya upakaṇṇake dhammaṃ desesi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:1.8.eng: After teaching the housewife in this way, Udāyī went up to the daughter-in-law and gave her a teaching in the same way.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:1.10.pli: “kiṃ nu kho so samaṇo gharasuṇhāya jāro udāhu obhāsatī”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:1.10.eng: “Is this monastic my daughter-in-law’s lover, or is he speaking indecently?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:1.11.pli: Atha kho āyasmā udāyī gharasuṇhāya upakaṇṇake dhammaṃ desetvā pakkāmi.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:1.12.eng: the housewife said to her daughter-in-law,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:1.13.pli: “he je, kiṃ te eso samaṇo avocā”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:1.13.eng: “Hey, what did that monastic say to you?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:1.15.eng: But what did he say to you?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:1.17.eng: And they complained and criticized him,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:1.18.pli: “kathañhi nāma ayyo udāyī upakaṇṇake dhammaṃ desessati.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:1.18.eng: “How can Venerable Udāyī give teachings by whispering in the ear?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:1.19.pli: Nanu nāma vissaṭṭhena vivaṭena dhammo desetabbo”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:1.19.eng: Should not teachings be given audibly and openly?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:1.20.pli: Assosuṃ kho bhikkhū tāsaṃ itthīnaṃ ujjhāyantīnaṃ khiyyantīnaṃ vipācentīnaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:1.20.eng: The monks heard the complaints of those women,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:1.21.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:1.21.eng: and the monks of few desires complained and criticized Udāyī,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:1.22.pli: “kathañhi nāma āyasmā udāyī mātugāmassa dhammaṃ desessatī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:1.22.eng: “How can Venerable Udāyī give teachings to women?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:1.23.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū āyasmantaṃ udāyiṃ anekapariyāyena vigarahitvā bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:1.23.eng: After rebuking him in many ways, they told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned Udāyī:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:1.24.pli: “saccaṃ kira tvaṃ, udāyi, mātugāmassa dhammaṃ desesī”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:1.24.eng: “Is it true, Udāyī, that you did this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:1.27.pli: kathañhi nāma tvaṃ, moghapurisa, mātugāmassa dhammaṃ desessasi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:1.27.eng: “Foolish man, how can you do this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:1.29.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:1.29.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:1.30.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu mātugāmassa dhammaṃ deseyya pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:1.30.1.eng: ‘If a monk gives a teaching to a woman, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:1.31.pli: Evañcidaṃ bhagavatā bhikkhūnaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ paññattaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:1.31.eng: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:2.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena upāsikā bhikkhū passitvā etadavocuṃ—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:2.1.eng: Soon afterwards some female lay followers saw some monks and said to them,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:2.3.eng: “It’s not allowable for us to teach women.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:2.4.pli: “Iṅghāyyā, chappañcavācāhi dhammaṃ desetha, sakkā ettakenapi dhammo aññātun”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:2.4.eng: “Just teach five or six sentences. That might be enough for us to understand.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:2.5.eng: “It’s not allowable for us to teach women.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:2.6.eng: And being afraid of wrongdoing, they did not teach them.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:2.7.eng: Those female lay followers complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:2.8.pli: “kathañhi nāma, ayyā, amhehi yācīyamānā dhammaṃ na desessantī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:2.8.eng: “How can they not teach us when asked?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:2.9.pli: Assosuṃ kho bhikkhū tāsaṃ upāsikānaṃ ujjhāyantīnaṃ khiyyantīnaṃ vipācentīnaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:2.9.eng: The monks heard the complaints of those female lay followers,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:2.10.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:2.11.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:2.11.eng: Soon afterwards the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:2.12.eng: “Monks, I allow you to teach five or six sentences to a woman.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:2.13.pli: Evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:2.13.eng: And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:2.14.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhū mātugāmassa uttarichappañcavācāhi dhammaṃ deseyya, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:2.14.1.eng: ‘If a monk gives a teaching of more than five or six sentences to a woman, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:2.15.pli: Evañcidaṃ bhagavatā bhikkhūnaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ paññattaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:2.15.eng: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:3.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū—“bhagavatā anuññātaṃ mātugāmassa chappañcavācāhi dhammaṃ desetun”ti te aviññuṃ purisaviggahaṃ upanisīdāpetvā mātugāmassa uttarichappañcavācāhi dhammaṃ desenti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:3.1.eng: When the monks from the group of six heard that the Buddha had made this allowance, they taught women more than five or six sentences with a man who did not understand sitting nearby.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:3.2.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:3.2.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:3.3.pli: “kathañhi nāma chabbaggiyā bhikkhū aviññuṃ purisaviggahaṃ upanisīdāpetvā mātugāmassa uttarichappañcavācāhi dhammaṃ desessantī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:3.3.eng: “How can the monks from the group of six teach women more than five or six sentences with a man who doesn’t understand sitting nearby?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:3.4.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū chabbaggiye bhikkhū anekapariyāyena vigarahitvā bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:3.4.eng: After rebuking those monks in many ways, they told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:3.5.pli: “saccaṃ kira tumhe, bhikkhave, aviññuṃ purisaviggahaṃ upanisīdāpetvā mātugāmassa uttarichappañcavācāhi dhammaṃ desethā”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:3.5.eng: “Is it true, monks, that you do this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:3.8.pli: kathañhi nāma tumhe, moghapurisā, aviññuṃ purisaviggahaṃ upanisīdāpetvā mātugāmassa uttarichappañcavācāhi dhammaṃ desessatha.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:3.8.eng: “Foolish men, how can you do this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:3.10.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:3.10.eng: “And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:3.11.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu mātugāmassa uttarichappañcavācāhi dhammaṃ deseyya, aññatra viññunā purisaviggahena, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:3.11.1.eng: ‘If a monk gives a teaching of more than five or six sentences to a woman, except in the presence of a man who understands, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:4.1.4.eng: …The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:4.1.6.pli: manussitthī; na yakkhī na petī na tiracchānagatā; viññū, paṭibalā subhāsitadubbhāsitaṃ duṭṭhullāduṭṭhullaṃ ājānituṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:4.1.6.eng: a female human being, not a female spirit, not a female ghost, not a female animal; one who understands and is capable of discerning bad speech and good speech, what is indecent and what is decent.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:4.1.7.eng: More than five or six sentences:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:4.1.8.eng: in excess of five or six sentences.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:4.1.10.pli: buddhabhāsito, sāvakabhāsito, isibhāsito, devatābhāsito, atthūpasañhito, dhammūpasañhito.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:4.1.10.eng: what has been spoken by the Buddha, what has been spoken by disciples, what has been spoken by sages, what has been spoken by gods, what is connected with what is beneficial, what is connected with the Teaching.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:4.1.12.pli: padena deseti, pade pade āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:4.1.12.eng: if he teaches by the line, then for every line he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:4.1.13.eng: If he teaches by the syllable, then for every syllable he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:4.1.14.eng: Except in the presence of a man who understands:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:4.1.15.eng: unless a man who understands is present.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:4.1.15.comm: “Is present” is not actually found in the Pali, but it is implied.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:4.1.17.eng: one who is capable of discerning bad speech and good speech, what is indecent and what is decent.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:4.2.1.pli: Mātugāme mātugāmasaññī uttarichappañcavācāhi dhammaṃ deseti, aññatra viññunā purisaviggahena, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:4.2.1.eng: If it is a woman, and he perceives her as such, and he teaches her more than five or six sentences, except in the presence of a man who understands, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:4.2.2.pli: Mātugāme vematiko uttarichappañcavācāhi dhammaṃ deseti, aññatra viññunā purisaviggahena, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:4.2.2.eng: If it is a woman, but he is unsure of it, and he teaches her more than five or six sentences, except in the presence of a man who understands, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:4.2.3.pli: Mātugāme amātugāmasaññī uttarichappañcavācāhi dhammaṃ deseti, aññatra viññunā purisaviggahena, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:4.2.3.eng: If it is a woman, but he does not perceive her as such, and he teaches her more than five or six sentences, except in the presence of a man who understands, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:4.2.4.pli: Yakkhiyā vā petiyā vā paṇḍakassa vā tiracchānagatamanussaviggahitthiyā vā uttarichappañcavācāhi dhammaṃ deseti, aññatra viññunā purisaviggahena, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:4.2.4.eng: If he teaches more than five or six sentences to a female spirit, a female ghost, a paṇḍaka, or a female animal in the form of a woman, except in the presence of a man who understands, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:4.2.4.comm: For the meaning of paṇḍaka, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:4.2.5.eng: If it is not a woman, but he perceives them as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:4.2.6.eng: If it is not a woman, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:4.2.7.eng: If it is not a woman, and he does not perceive them as such, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:4.3.2.eng: if a man who understands is present;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:4.3.3.eng: if he teaches five or six sentences;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:4.3.4.eng: if he teaches fewer than five or six sentences;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:4.3.5.eng: if he gets up, sits down again, and then teaches;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:4.3.6.pli: mātugāmo uṭṭhahitvā puna nisīdati tasmiṃ deseti,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:4.3.6.eng: if the woman gets up and sits down again, and he then teaches her;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:4.3.6.comm: Sp 2.66: Sampadānatthe vā etaṁ bhummavacanaṁ. Tassā desetīti attho, “Or this locative case is in the meaning of the dative. The meaning is: he teaches her.” In other words, the locative tasmiṁ should be read as a dative.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:4.3.9.eng: if he is asked a question and then speaks;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:4.3.10.eng: if he is speaking for the benefit of someone else and a woman listens in;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:4.3.12.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:4.3.13.eng: The training rule on teaching, the seventh, is finished.
